message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.IR. 

The paper focuses on text classification using end-to-end neural architectures, which is a common topic in the natural language processing (NLP) field. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of convolutional and recurrent neural networks, which are common in machine learning and deep learning research, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) likely sub-categories as well. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of attention mechanisms, which are commonly used in NLP and computer vision tasks, making cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with feature extraction and post-processing, which are common topics in information retrieval and text mining, making cs.IR (Information Retrieval) a possible sub-category.
